perturbation.original_text: Party A undertakes to comply with the Business Cooperation Standard of Baidu Union published in http://union.baidu.com/regAgreement.html (see Annex 3), or otherwise Party A will be deemed to breach this Agreement. Party A also agrees to participate in the "Blue Sky 365" Action Plan and comply with Blue Sky 365 Action Plan Regulations (see Annex 4).
perturbation.changed_text: Party A should endeavor to align its practices with the Business Cooperation Standard of Baidu Union available at http://union.baidu.com/regAgreement.html (see Annex 3). Party A may participate in the "Blue Sky 365" Action Plan and should consider adhering to the general principles of the Blue Sky 365 Action Plan Regulations (see Annex 4).
perturbation.explanation: The modifications weaken the legally binding nature of Party A's commitment to the Business Cooperation Standard and the "Blue Sky 365" Action Plan. Replacing "undertakes to comply" with "should endeavor to align" and "agrees to participate and comply" with "may participate and should consider adhering to the general principles" introduces ambiguity and makes compliance discretionary rather than mandatory.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Article 4 of Contract Law of the People's Republic of China requires parties to perform their obligations in good faith. Changing mandatory actions to discretionary ones undermines this principle.

perturbation.original_text: Party B warrants that it legally owns or otherwise holds a valid license to the intellectual property relating to the services or products provided pursuant to this agreement. Any disputes resulting from the Party B's technology or intellectual property shall be handled by Party B; any losses and costs of Party A resulting from the deficiency of Party B's services or products shall be borne by Party B.
perturbation.changed_text: Party B represents that it believes it owns or holds a license to the intellectual property relating to the services or products provided pursuant to this agreement. Disputes resulting from Party B's technology or intellectual property will be addressed by Party B; any reasonable losses and costs of Party A arguably resulting from the deficiency of Party B's services or products may be considered for coverage by Party B.
perturbation.explanation: The modification weakens Party B's warranty regarding intellectual property ownership by changing "warrants that it legally owns" to "represents that it believes it owns". The shift from "shall be borne by Party B" to "may be considered for coverage by Party B" introduces ambiguity and makes the obligation to cover losses discretionary, instead of a guaranteed obligation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Article 169 of the General Provisions of the Civil Law of the People's Republic of China says if someone infringes on the intellectual property of another, the infringed party can seek compensation.

perturbation.original_text: Party A provides the invoice of the share of revenues in the preceding month within the first 5 working days in each month in advance, Party B warrants to pay the share of revenues to Party A prior to the 20t h day of each month (postponed in the event of public holidays) according to Article 4.1 hereof. In the event that Party A objects the payment from Party B, it shall propose within the first 5 working days in each month in writing, or it will be deemed as no objection. Party B shall review within three working days upon receipt of Party A's written objection and notify the results thereof to Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: Party A may provide an invoice for the share of revenues in the preceding month within a reasonable time frame, and Party B will endeavor to pay the share of revenues to Party A approximately by the 20th day of each month, subject to internal processing times. If Party A has concerns regarding the payment, it should notify Party B in a timely fashion. Party B will make a reasonable effort to review such concerns.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a specific time frame with a 'warrant'. The perturbed text changes this to 'may provide an invoice for the share of revenues in the preceding month within a reasonable time frame', and changes 'Party B warrants to pay the share of revenues to Party A prior to the 20t h day of each month' to 'Party B will endeavor to pay the share of revenues to Party A approximately by the 20th day of each month, subject to internal processing times'. 'Reasonable' and 'approximately' add ambiguity and uncertainty around the actual payment deadlines. This also affects the objection procedures. The new sentence 'If Party A has concerns regarding the payment, it should notify Party B in a timely fashion.' replaces 'In the event that Party A objects the payment from Party B, it shall propose within the first 5 working days in each month in writing, or it will be deemed as no objection.'
perturbation.contradicted_law: Article 62 of the Contract Law of the People's Republic of China: Where the particulars such as the contents, time limit, place or method of performance are not clearly stipulated, if the supplemental agreement cannot be reached, it shall be determined in accordance with the relevant provisions of this Contract or commercial practice.
